instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blowing 5vs3 componenets up
threads.message:
Hi got a mega strange <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. it was working fine and pop, <CAPACITOR>C4696</CAPACITOR> blows out. I replace it and the same happens again, i replace the entire USB power circuit, same again. i just think- ill rmeove USB power completely and see what it does, after a little while some more smoke comes out, this time its blown a whole in <CHIP>U7300</CHIP>, a previusly working component, Its also destroyed the pp5vs3 trace on it.

Seems to be blowing up anything random on the pp5vs3 rail at this point.
Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blowing 5vs3 componenets up
threads.message: Over voltage from somewhere. Good chance the board is totally fried now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blowing 5vs3 componenets up
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blowing 5vs3 componenets up
threads.message: If the board is still alive I'd replace <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7260</TRANSISTOR>. I have no other ideas what can cause the voltage spikes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> blowing 5vs3 componenets up
threads.message: yeah, i can get it to run again i reckon. Thanks for the suggestions.
